abstract: The Houston Astros, after finishing dead last in their division two years in a row, are repurposing a state song in their “Whole New Ballgame” campaign.
snippet: The Houston Astros, after finishing dead last in their division two years in a row, are repurposing a state song in their “Whole New Ballgame” campaign.
lead_paragraph: BASEBALL and music have a long history together, as evidenced by “Take Me Out to the Ballgame,” “Damn Yankees,” “There Used to Be a Ballpark” and “Talkin’ Baseball” — not to mention the novelty songs played in stadiums during the seventh inning stretch, like “Lazy Mary” at Citi Field, home of the New York Mets.

headline.main: Deep in the Heart of Baseball
headline.print_headline: Deep in the Heart of Baseball
